Who is Neal Katyal? Indian-American lawyer who could upend Trump's tariff war
description: Neal Katyal, an Indian-American attorney, will argue before the Supreme Court whether President Trump has the authority to impose sweeping tariffs under IEEPA. The landmark case, deemed critically important by Trump himself, centers on whether taxing power rests with Congress or the President. Katyal previously secured a win for plaintiffs in a lower court, asserting the President lacks such authority.

Will George Pickens play against Arizona Cardinals tonight?
description: Dallas Cowboys' star receiver George Pickens is cleared to play in Monday Night Football against the Arizona Cardinals. The 24-year-old has been a vital offensive weapon, boasting impressive yardage and touchdown stats. His availability is crucial for Dallas' explosive passing attack as they aim to extend their winning streak at AT&T Stadium.

description: India's women's cricket team achieved a historic victory, winning their first ICC ODI World Cup. Skipper Harmanpreet Kaur led the team to a 52-run win against South Africa. The triumph marks a significant moment for Indian women's sports. The team's performance and captain's leadership are highlighted. This win signifies the start of a new era for women's cricket in India.

title: Arrested after 32 years in the 1992 hospital shootout, accused denies identity, court rejects discharge and bail plea
'Khatron Ke Khiladi': BJP hails Tharoor's article on dynastic politics; Cong hits back
description: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor's article criticizing dynastic politics has been seized upon by the BJP. Tharoor's essay, calling it a "grave threat to Indian democracy," highlighted the Nehru-Gandhi family's influence and extended the critique to other INDIA bloc parties. BJP leaders lauded Tharoor's "insightful" piece, using it to target the Congress leadership.

Daboo Malik on son Amaal Mallik’s secret girlfriend and health issues: ‘I don’t understand who is stopping him from leaving Bigg Boss’
Critical lifeline: Indian docs, nurses backbone of US, EU healthcare - OECD report
description: Indian doctors and nurses are now crucial to advanced economies, with the OECD reporting a significant surge in their numbers. India is the top source of migrant doctors and second for nurses in member countries. This reliance highlights both a vital support and a potential vulnerability for global healthcare systems.

'Chana kha rahe the?': Jemimah reacts to Mandhana's 'win' - watch
description: Amanjot Kaur's spectacular catch to dismiss South Africa's captain Laura Wolvaardt proved a turning point in the Women's World Cup final, securing India's maiden title.  Her crucial fielding, alongside Deepti Sharma's all-round performance and Shafali Verma's batting, led India to a historic 52-run victory. Jemimah Rodrigues playfully protested Smriti Mandhana topping the leaderboard set by fielding coach Munish Bali.

Nepal: 7 killed in avalanche on Yalung Ri mountain; 5 foreign climbers among dead
description: Tragedy struck Mount Yalung Ri in Nepal as an avalanche claimed the lives of seven individuals, including five foreign climbers and two local guides. Five others sustained injuries in the incident at the mountain's base camp. Rescue efforts are underway to reach the remote location, hampered by challenging terrain and weather.

Leadership change? 'Smriti Mandhana should take over from Harmanpreet Kaur'
description: Following India's historic ODI World Cup win, former captain Shantha Rangaswamy urged Harmanpreet Kaur to step down, believing it would benefit her batting and fielding. Rangaswamy suggested Smriti Mandhana as the ideal successor across formats, emphasizing the need for future planning. She also highlighted bowling as a concern despite the victory.

title: Woman’s body found packed in travel bag, probe on: Police
One question that made OpenAI CEO Sam Altman 'uneasy'
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman defended massive spending plans, dismissing concerns about the company's financial projections. He asserted OpenAI's revenue is higher than reported and offered to find buyers for shares from critics. Altman emphasized a strategy of steep revenue growth across multiple ventures, confident in future expansion and technological advancements.

Why Zohran Mamdani cannot be the new Barack Obama
description: The Obama analogy flatters everyone — liberals nostalgic for 2008, Mamdani himself, and commentators desperate for a “narrative.” But it is also wrong, for reasons that have less to do with Mamdani’s talent and more to do with where he is, who he is, and the country he is trying to win.

Bihar polls: The ‘ruins of Marhowra’ make jobs a touchy topic
description: Marhowra, once a symbol of Bihar's industrial might with its sugar mill and engineering company, now grapples with defunct factories and job scarcity. Despite new ventures like a diesel locomotive plant, locals seek substantial employment. The revival of old industries remains a distant hope amidst electoral promises and economic challenges.

India’s hiring shift: Experience matters; degrees alone no longer guarantee jobs
description: Indian students are shifting focus from mere degrees to demonstrable skills as employers prioritize practical experience.  Companies are actively collaborating with universities to co-design curricula and build talent pipelines.  Apprenticeship programs are experiencing a significant resurgence, offering students hands-on learning and a faster entry into the workforce.  This marks a crucial mindset reset for the nation's talent ecosystem.

title: NTA clarifies: No calculators allowed in JEE (Main); 'typo' sparks confusion
description: Confusion erupted over calculator use in JEE (Main) 2026 after the NTA's initial bulletin mentioned an on-screen calculator. The agency swiftly clarified this was a typographical error, stating calculators are strictly prohibited. Officials explained the mistake stemmed from adapting general instructions from other exams. A revised bulletin now confirms the ban, following intervention from the Ministry of Education.

title: 'Ashamed?' PM asks why Lalu missing from RJD posters; Tejashwi hits back
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi attacked the RJD in poll-bound Bihar, questioning the absence of Lalu Prasad Yadav from party posters and his son Tejashwi's reluctance to mention his father's name. Modi alleged this indicates the RJD is trying to hide its "jungle raj" legacy from the youth.

title: 'I'm broken': Lone AI-171 crash survivor speaks out; now stranded in UK
description: Four-and-a-half months after a devastating Air India crash, sole survivor Viswashkumar Ramesh faces ongoing physical injuries, financial hardship, and deep trauma. He has not yet received NHS psychiatric care and his family's business has collapsed. Ramesh finds Air India's interim compensation inadequate for his needs.

title: India's World Cup win: Twitter 'explodes' 456%; shares Virat Kohli tweet
description: India's women's cricket team has achieved a historic maiden World Cup victory, sparking a massive 456.5% surge in conversations on X (formerly Twitter) within 24 hours. The nation erupted in celebration after the team's dominant performance against South Africa. This monumental win, lauded by figures like Virat Kohli, Sundar Pichai, and Satya Nadella, marks a new era for women's cricket in India and inspires future generations.

title: Mets tipped to sign $16M Braves star as Pete Alonso replacement before deadline
description: The New York Mets are eyeing Atlanta Braves slugger Marcell Ozuna as a potential replacement for Pete Alonso, whose future with the team is uncertain. Ozuna, a veteran power hitter, could fill a crucial gap in the Mets' lineup. The Braves' shift in DH strategy might make the three-time All-Star available, offering New York a surprising, yet impactful, solution.

title: When the body attacks its joints: Expert explains inflammatory arthritis
description: Inflammatory arthritis, where the immune system attacks healthy joints, demands early attention. Watch for persistent joint pain, swelling, morning stiffness exceeding 30 minutes, fatigue, fever, symmetrical pain, and unexplained weight loss. Timely diagnosis and management through medication, gentle exercise, a balanced diet, stress control, and regular check-ups can prevent dependency and ensure active lives.

title: Taylor Swift worried about security as Travis Kelce focuses on new season
description: Taylor Swift is reportedly concerned about her security and privacy, wanting to avoid excessive media attention during Kansas City Chiefs games. While not asking for broadcasts to stop, she desires to maintain a lower profile. Meanwhile, Travis Kelce praised Swift's latest album, "The Life of a Showgirl," on his podcast, highlighting its success.

title: Comet 3I/ATLAS: Musk, Rogan talk about alien object; link it to The Tunguska Event
description: Unauthorized SpaceX Starshield transmissions coincide with intense scrutiny of Comet 3I/ATLAS, an interstellar object exhibiting anomalous characteristics. Discussions on The Joe Rogan Experience podcast, featuring Elon Musk, explored potential alien probes and the Tunguska Event, fueled by astrophysicist Avi Loeb's claims of extraterrestrial origins for the comet.

title: Vanessa Bryant recalls Kobe’s heartbreaking moment focused on Gianna
description: Vanessa Bryant is releasing a photo book, 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever,' featuring cherished memories of Kobe and Gianna Bryant. She shared a touching moment from the 2009 NBA Finals, where Kobe cradled a young Gigi, his focus solely on his daughter's pride. The book aims to preserve these heartfelt moments for the world to remember.
